title: Convert to Exponential Form

title: Rewrite $$\frac{1}{16}$$ in terms of $$\frac{1}{2}$$
text: Since $$2^4=16$$, we can actually rewrite $$\frac{1}{16}$$ in terms of $$\frac{1}{2}$$. What is $$\frac{1}{16}$$ equal to in terms of $$\frac{1}{2}$$?
speech: Since  2 to the fourth is equal to 16 , we can actually rewrite  1 over 16,  in terms of  1 half . What is  1 over 16,  equal to in terms of  1 half ?
pacedSpeech: Since   2 to the fourth is equal to 16
equal to in terms of   1 half

title: Simplifying the Exponential
text: We note that $${\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)}^y=x^{\left(-y\right)}$$. How can we rewrite $$\frac{1}{16}={\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)}^4$$ in terms of powers of 2?
speech: We note that  parentheses 1 over x,  to the y-th is equal to x raised to the parentheses negative y  power . How can we rewrite  1 over 16 is equal to, parentheses 1 half  to the fourth  in terms of powers of 2?

. How can we rewrite   1 over 16 is equal to,  1 half  to the fourth

title: Solve for $$x$$
text: Substitution $$2^{\left(-4\right)}$$ into the exponential equation we found before, we get $$2^x=2^{\left(-4\right)}$$. What is $$x$$?
